name: MRR
formula: Sum of all active subscriptions × monthly price
interpretation: Core revenue health indicator; track Net New MRR breakdown (new + expansion - contraction - churn) to understand growth drivers

name: ARR
formula: MRR × 12
interpretation: Annualized view preferred by investors; use for YoY comparisons and fundraising benchmarks

name: Growth Rate (MoM)
formula: (Current Month MRR - Prior Month MRR) / Prior Month MRR
interpretation: Sustained high MoM growth signals product-market fit; declining MoM is natural at scale but watch for sudden drops

name: Growth Rate (YoY)
formula: (Current Year ARR - Prior Year ARR) / Prior Year ARR
interpretation: Better long-term trend indicator than MoM; less noisy and preferred by later-stage investors

name: Net Revenue Retention (NRR)
formula: (Beginning ARR + Expansion - Contraction - Churn) / Beginning ARR
interpretation: Above 100% means existing customers grow faster than churn; best-in-class SaaS exceeds 120%
related_metrics: Logo Churn Rate;Revenue Churn Rate;Expansion MRR;LTV

name: CAC
formula: Total Sales & Marketing Spend / New Customers Acquired
interpretation: Include all S&M costs (salaries; tools; ads; overhead); segment by channel to find most efficient acquisition paths

name: LTV
formula: ARPU × Gross Margin% × (1 / Monthly Churn Rate)
interpretation: Higher LTV supports higher CAC spending; sensitivity-test by varying churn assumptions; segment by cohort and plan tier

name: LTV:CAC Ratio
formula: LTV / CAC
interpretation: Below 1.0 is unsustainable (losing money per customer); 3.0+ is healthy; above 5.0 may signal underinvestment in growth

name: CAC Payback Period
formula: CAC / (ARPU × Gross Margin%)
interpretation: Measures months to recoup acquisition cost; shorter payback preserves cash; >24 months is a red flag for investors

name: ARPU
formula: Total MRR / Total Active Customers
interpretation: Track trends over time; rising ARPU via upsells is a strong signal; segment by plan tier and customer size

name: Gross Margin
formula: (Revenue - COGS) / Revenue
interpretation: SaaS typically 70-85%; lower margins indicate high infrastructure or support costs; critical input to LTV and payback calculations

name: Contribution Margin
formula: (Revenue - COGS - Variable Costs) / Revenue
interpretation: More granular than gross margin; includes variable S&M costs; shows true per-unit profitability after all variable expenses

name: Logo Churn Rate
formula: Customers Lost in Period / Customers at Start of Period
interpretation: Measures customer count attrition; high logo churn with stable revenue churn suggests small customers leaving; segment by cohort
related_metrics: Revenue Churn Rate;Net Revenue Retention;Logo Retention;LTV

name: Revenue Churn Rate
formula: Churned MRR / Starting MRR
interpretation: Revenue-weighted churn; more important than logo churn because losing large customers hurts more; track gross and net separately
related_metrics: Logo Churn Rate;Net Revenue Retention;MRR;Gross Retention

name: Net Revenue Retention
formula: (Starting MRR + Expansion - Contraction - Churn) / Starting MRR
interpretation: The single most important SaaS retention metric; >100% means growth from existing customers alone without any new sales

name: Cohort Retention
formula: Users Active in Period from Cohort / Original Cohort Size
interpretation: Plot retention curves by signup cohort; flattening curve = habit formation; improving cohorts over time = product getting better

name: DAU/MAU Ratio
formula: Daily Active Users / Monthly Active Users
interpretation: Measures engagement frequency; >50% is exceptional (daily habit like social/messaging); <20% suggests weak daily value proposition

name: Activation Rate
formula: Users Completing Key Action / Total New Signups
interpretation: Defines as reaching 'aha moment'; optimize onboarding to improve; single biggest lever for retention and downstream metrics
related_metrics: Cohort Retention;Time to Value;DAU/MAU Ratio;Feature Adoption Rate

name: Burn Multiple
formula: Net Burn / Net New ARR
interpretation: Lower is better; measures cost to generate each dollar of new ARR; <1.0 is exceptional efficiency; >3.0 signals capital inefficiency

name: Rule of 40
formula: Revenue Growth Rate% + Profit Margin%
interpretation: Balances growth against profitability; >40% is excellent; high-growth companies can have negative margins if growth compensates

name: Magic Number
formula: Net New ARR (Quarter) / S&M Spend (Prior Quarter)
interpretation: Measures S&M efficiency; >0.75 means ready to invest more in sales; <0.5 means fix efficiency before scaling spend

name: Hype Ratio
formula: Valuation / ARR
interpretation: Investor sentiment indicator; very high ratios need strong growth to justify; declining ratio with flat growth is warning sign

name: Growth Efficiency Index
formula: Net New ARR / Net Burn
interpretation: Inverse of burn multiple; higher is better; >1.0 means generating more ARR than burning cash; shows path to capital efficiency

name: Viral Coefficient
formula: Invites per User × Invite Conversion Rate
interpretation: K>1.0 means exponential organic growth; even K=0.3 meaningfully reduces CAC; track by channel (email; social; in-product)

name: Runway
formula: Cash Balance / Monthly Burn Rate
interpretation: Always maintain 12+ months; start fundraising at 6-9 months remaining; runway <6 months is crisis territory

name: Burn Rate
formula: Monthly Expenses - Monthly Revenue
interpretation: Track gross burn (total spend) and net burn (after revenue); decreasing net burn with growing revenue shows path to profitability

name: Cash Conversion Score
formula: Free Cash Flow / Net Income
interpretation: Measures how efficiently profit converts to cash; negative early-stage is normal; improving trend matters more than absolute value

name: Quick Ratio (SaaS)
formula: (New MRR + Expansion MRR) / (Churned MRR + Contraction MRR)
interpretation: Measures growth efficiency vs churn; >4.0 is healthy; <2.0 indicates a churn problem offsetting new growth
related_metrics: Net Revenue Retention;Revenue Churn Rate;Expansion MRR;MRR

name: Operating Leverage
formula: Revenue Growth Rate / Operating Expense Growth Rate
interpretation: Ratio >1.0 means revenue growing faster than costs; indicates scalable unit economics; key to path-to-profitability narrative

name: Revenue Per Employee
formula: ARR / Full-Time Employees
interpretation: Proxy for organizational efficiency; best-in-class SaaS reaches $300K+; track trend as you scale to ensure productive hiring

name: GMV
formula: Sum of all transaction values on platform
interpretation: Total economic activity on marketplace; growth rate matters more than absolute number early on; 20%+ MoM at seed is strong

name: Take Rate
formula: Net Revenue / GMV
interpretation: Balance between platform value capture and seller/buyer economics; too high drives disintermediation; too low limits business model

name: Liquidity
formula: Transactions Completed / Listings or Requests
interpretation: Core marketplace health metric; measures probability of successful match; low liquidity = chicken-and-egg problem not solved
related_metrics: GMV;Time to First Transaction;Supply/Demand Ratio;Repeat Rate

name: Repeat Rate
formula: Users with 2+ Transactions / Total Transacting Users
interpretation: Strong repeat rate validates marketplace value; reduces reliance on new user acquisition; drives LTV and organic growth

name: Supply/Demand Ratio
formula: Active Supply Units / Active Demand Units
interpretation: Imbalance causes friction; too much supply = low fill rates; too much demand = long wait times; actively manage both sides

name: Time to First Transaction
formula: Median time from signup to first completed transaction
interpretation: Shorter time = lower drop-off; optimize onboarding to reduce; long times indicate friction or trust barriers in the platform

name: DAU/WAU/MAU
formula: Count of unique users active in daily/weekly/monthly windows
interpretation: Track all three and their ratios; DAU/MAU >50% is exceptional; growing MAU with flat DAU signals engagement problem

name: Session Duration
formula: Total Time in App / Number of Sessions
interpretation: Context-dependent: productivity tools want shorter focused sessions; content/social wants longer; always pair with session frequency

name: Feature Adoption Rate
formula: Users Using Feature / Total Active Users
interpretation: Track per-feature to identify what drives retention; low adoption of key features = UX or discovery problem; informs roadmap priority

name: NPS
formula: % Promoters (9-10) - % Detractors (0-6)
interpretation: Lagging indicator of product satisfaction; >50 is excellent; track by segment and cohort; follow up on detractor feedback for churn prevention
related_metrics: Cohort Retention;Logo Churn Rate;Viral Coefficient;Activation Rate

name: Time to Value
formula: Median time from signup to first value-delivery moment
interpretation: Shorter TTV = higher activation and retention; optimize onboarding; reduce setup friction; guide users to aha moment quickly
related_metrics: Activation Rate;Time to First Transaction;Cohort Retention;Feature Adoption Rate

name: Stickiness
formula: DAU / MAU (also called Stickiness Ratio)
interpretation: Measures habitual usage; high stickiness = strong daily value proposition; low stickiness with high MAU = occasional use pattern
related_metrics: DAU/MAU Ratio;Session Duration;Cohort Retention;Feature Adoption Rate
